statement: A new EIP-2718 transaction type with type 2 is introduced at FORK_BLOCK_NUMBER
Transaction type 2 payload is rlp([chain_id, nonce, max_priority_fee_per_gas, max_fee_per_gas, gas_limit, destination, amount, data, access_list, signature_y_parity, signature_r, signature_s])
Signature for type 2 transaction is secp256k1 signature over keccak256(0x02 || rlp([chain_id, nonce, max_priority_fee_per_gas, max_fee_per_gas, gas_limit, destination, amount, data, access_list]))
Intrinsic cost of type 2 transaction is 21000 + 16 * non-zero calldata bytes + 4 * zero calldata bytes + 1900 * access list storage key count + 2400 * access list address count
Transaction receipt payload is rlp([status, cumulative_transaction_gas_used, logs_bloom, logs])
Base fee per gas moves up or down each block according to a formula based on gas used in parent block and gas target of parent block
Base fee per gas increases when parent block gas used exceeds parent gas target
Base fee per gas decreases when parent block gas used is below parent gas target
Gas target is block gas limit divided by elasticity multiplier (2x)
Base fee per gas is always burned (destroyed by protocol, not given to miners)
Transactions specify max_priority_fee_per_gas (priority fee to incentivize miners)
Transactions specify max_fee_per_gas (maximum total fee covering priority fee and base fee)
Signer pays base fee per gas of the block their transaction is included in
Signer pays priority fee per gas as specified in transaction (if combined fees do not exceed max_fee_per_gas)
Priority fee per gas is capped at min(max_priority_fee_per_gas, max_fee_per_gas - base_fee_per_gas)
Effective gas price returned by GASPRICE opcode is priority_fee_per_gas + base_fee_per_gas
Miner receives only the priority fee (not the base fee which is burned)
Block gas used must not exceed block gas limit
Block gas limit change from parent is limited to parent_gas_limit / 1024 (can increase or decrease)
Block gas limit must be at least 5000
At fork block (FORK_BLOCK_NUMBER), initial base fee per gas is 1000000000
At fork block, gas target is parent gas limit (no elasticity multiplier division)
When parent gas used equals parent gas target, base fee remains unchanged
When parent gas used exceeds parent gas target, base fee delta is max(parent_base_fee * gas_used_delta // parent_gas_target // 8, 1)
When parent gas used is below parent gas target, base fee delta is parent_base_fee * gas_used_delta // parent_gas_target // 8
Signer must have enough balance to cover transaction amount
Signer must have enough balance to cover gas_limit * max_fee_per_gas
Signer must have enough balance to cover gas_limit * effective_gas_price after amount deduction
max_fee_per_gas must be >= base_fee_per_gas of the block
max_fee_per_gas must be < 2^256 (prevent impossibly large numbers)
max_priority_fee_per_gas must be < 2^256 (prevent impossibly large numbers)
max_fee_per_gas must be >= max_priority_fee_per_gas
Block cumulative gas used must equal sum of gas used in all transactions
Signer is refunded for unused gas at effective_gas_price
GASPRICE opcode (0x3a) must return effective_gas_price
